intro: Leucopogon mollis, commonly known as the silky leucopogon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Leucopogon mollis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
